title: How many more mobile champions are next?
body:
Hey I just can't wait for the next mobile champion especially after {{champion:429}}  and {{champion:421}}, you know? I mean really, its so fun to just press the magic button and make everyone cry in tears that they can't kill you. Especially against {{champion:77}}, since when was the last time I ever saw that champion, the beginning of last season? I'm so happy that we can have an endless cycle of CC is countered by mobility, so therefore you need even more cc to counter they're mobility. I just love how {{champion:238}}  doesn't actually take skill in comparison to a mage like {{champion:45}}, since there's no room to give a champion like that power {{champion:238}}  therefore becomes EASIER! HAH! Isn't that just great?
Alright so if it wasn't obvious, I'm being entirely sarcastic. I think its ridiculous that Riot hasn't perfected they're already existing champions and just goes on to make more that are seemingly clones of previous ones. Think {{champion:429}} to {{champion:110}}, if that's what you call original then I applaud you on your fucking huge ego. *Claps...... Then scratches his eyes out.*
Could you take a break for a few months without releasing a new champion and fix the problems with the old ones? Oh yeah I remember there was a time a couple of you Rioters said you actually thought Mercial Crucible was what kept {{champion:22}} and {{champion:110}} from being good picks, and I'm still not sure if that's what you believe. I just wish you could communicate with us and ask us "Why are assassins on the rise?" So we can answer that by saying: "You nerfed everything that wasn't broken." Or: "Why are utility champions never picked over SUPER SAFE champions?" Then: "Because there isn't itemization that benefits from utility, but there is pure itemization built for bursty mobile champions." What if there actually was an item that scaled with utility and granted burst based on that alone?
Some people out there might think: "But utility gives power to your teammates, not only yourself! You can't make it even POSSIBLE for them to come up to the same level of mobile champions!"
But then you should think, isn't mobility helping your team out? "Oh sh-" Yeah, not dying is op; Being able to go in, and burst people down before they can do any damage to that 150 health Mundo is apparently op. It shouldn't surprise anyone if some players built BorK and Last Wisper on they're second and third items just so that they could instantly kill the jungle, top laner, and support. But they have mobility, so they don't have to actually trade with anyone else.

replies.body:
"Zed doesn't take skill in comparison to Veigar"

Wait what? The only thing Veigar needs skill for is landing smartcasted E, otherwise you just press 1 button late game (usually R) to kill a random person on their team.

Zed needs manipulaitng of shadows in a way to make flashy outplays and stuff that wouldn't be possible if you were a casual Zed player.

I main both (i prefer playing Veigar tbh cause i don't have to put myself at risk or anything to instantly kill the opponent) and this is some BS

it should really read like this "Veigar *shouldn't* take skill in comparison to Zed".  But Veigar requires a tough lane phase, mana management, sufficient items and farming, and is super vulnerable all game long.  Everything that Zed was designed to do is squandered by his over-abundance of strength in just ulting, spamming abilities and then shadowing or re-ulting to safety.  There is little skill left in Zed, especially since he gets bonus AD on his W and can build pure armor pen and a bork, and then take every tower in the game.  Last I checked, positional mastery and mana management takes more skill than bashing your face on your keyboard to get a guarenteed kill and get out, whilst splitpushing taking the incredibly weak towers
No?  Veigar gets good at his stun, uses it to free farm all day, then qr autokills people.  That's even easier than LB.
uh lane phase has a pre 6.  And good luck using your E to get harass, as you will OOM yourself in one rotation and then have zero pressure or ability to stack Q

Sure, but it really doesn't take very long for a solo laner to get level 6, so he can be careful for that short period of time.  Especially when he's in the most gankable lane.

I'm not talking about the E for harass?  Who does that?  I'm talking about defensive stunning, so when you get anywhere near him you get stunned and free bursted.  Sure that costs alot of mana, but now the other guy is almost dead, so I'd say it was worth it :P

What mana management? Start flask and mana pots and use Q everytime it's up. You never have to use any other spells because you can't trade early and because W is AoE it could push the wave, which is something you do not want as a Veigar.

*Needs items and farm*
Zed requires at least 2 "half" items to actually become a threat. 
Veigar negates his mana costs (for the most part) with 1 item and he doesn't need items to be a threat early game because he gains AP from Q, has high base damages and ratios on abilities and against an AP mid has a 80% AP scalling.

Mana management takes less skill than predicting everything the opponent might do to outplay them.
Predicting and outplaying also takes way more skill than pressing R then typing /laugh

Zed R deals only 100% of his AD, it requires you to use his other skills and puts Zed in melee range.

Veigar ult has 500 base, 120% AP scaling(even ignoring the fact that Veigar has high AP makes this ridiculous), 80% enemy AP scaling. You type /laugh cause it's not automatic anymore

> since when was the last time I ever saw that champion, the beginning of last season?

Did you somehow miss the entire release of FF?

>  I just love how {{champion:238}}  doesn't actually take skill in comparison to a mage 

I'm sorry to break your bubble, but you're just trying to fish for upvotes now. Zed is strong, yes. But he also has a high skill cap, and his skill floor isn't even particularly low. I don't think anyone has ever disputed that.

> Could you take a break for a few months without releasing a new champion and fix the problems with the old ones? 

Two different teams entirely. Champion design and live balance aren't that interchangeable.

> What if there actually was an item that scaled with utility and granted burst based on that alone?

How on earth would it even work?

So I'm a bit tired and grouchy right now, I'll admit it, but mobility has its own drawbacks. Kalista has one of the lowest damage outputs of any adc, Rek'sai is nothing special now after her nerfs, and next patch, a bunch of assassins are trading in damage to keep their mobilty. Everyone makes tradeoffs.

1. Play Zed. New players screw up his ult constantly, Zed cannot ult, miss all his abilities and magically blow up a mage, no matter how much you think so, if the mage manages to get hit by all of Zeds abilities, early on, then they still have a chance of living, if they don't then OH NO! An assassin assassinated someone.

2. No Riot can not just move the balance team and design team around interchangeably, It wastes time, Trying to get a balance team member caught up in what they are designing, literally just wastes time, especially in an area he isn't as skilled in. You people think having 6 or 8 people in a team is somehow a bad thing. 

3. Rek Sai is not overpowered. She was a bit overtuned in some scaling, but Rek Sai sucks, and I have no idea what her role in the game is really suppose to be, because it isn't being a tank. And being a fighter is pretty meh, because her ult is just an crappy version of teleport. (Imagine if you can only teleport to visible wards that show up on the minimap) 
She doesn't even clear the jungle or gank all that well.

4. Kalista or whatever that spawn of hell is, is overpowered in mobility, not damage, she gets her damage when fools try getting her while she kites infinitely, Otherwise playing Ashe or Sivir, I eat that bitch for breakfast.

1. Play any champion other than Zed.  Better yet, play a mage against Zed.  I dare ya.  One partial combo at 6 can take down any squishy.  Now if it could take 80% of their health, that's one thing.  That's an assassin.  But to take down a champion all by himself with one combo id ridiculous.  Riot has even admitted Zed can one combo kill just about any mage early game, and they like it.  So don't go and pretend like it isn't there :P

2. We all have human brains.  You're not thinking clearly, and sadly there's no reasoning with a toxic member of the community who won't take a moment to consider outside of the box thinking.  I want to elaborate but three sentences in I realized I was wasting my time, I'm sorry you feel this way.  Riot has done it before.

3. You have been stuck in lower division bronze all your LoL career, so I can understand the confusion.  See, mobility and vision is CRUCIAL to gameplay.  It's not about having a shitty teleport, it's about having mobility to reach your team/allies, objectives, and more at ease.  A 'fighter' as you put it is very nice in gameplay.  She has some CC, range when it's needed, gap closers, and a hefty amount of health to keep her fighting.  She can be either tanky or damage, but I've seen some great plays when going mostly tank (I've only made it to Silver myself, so I haven't seen her being fully utilized I'm sure).  You can also do some pretty neat tricks with her tunnels such as hiding traps or identifying where your enemy is (or isn't).

4. Anyone who has been against a GOOD Kalist can agree she has a lot of damage.  What she lacks in, however, is reach.  Take Cait.  Cait can completely outreach Kalist, but Kalist's mobility can be a real bitch if you don't have a support to tell them to back off.  Kalist can also (as I call it) 'bunny hop' to and away from her foes, essentially giving her the mobility I'm sure you're implying.  Sure it's very powerful, but so is Flash, Ghost, and Sivir's ult... and not to mention the several support items.  You just said Rek is useless because all he has is mobility, and now you're saying Kalist is OP because she's too mobile.  Make up your mind.  And yea, I know it's Kalista, I don't know why I shorten it to kalist.
EDIT:
Not to mention Ashe has her ult with amazing CC potential (q/w), but Sivir has great reach with her Q.  If you can get out of Bronze, you'll see some great plays esp by Sivir who is VERY strong.  I highly don't you 'eat that bitch for breakfast,' because a strong Sivir player can be terrifying.  Good luck though... seems like everyone is being dropped into Bronze who was Silver, and Bronze players are going to elo hell.  The soft reset was far from a soft touch.
